    • Constructor Detail

      • ViewManager

        public ViewManager()
        ViewManager constructor. Called by the loader class before the initialize method by the controller, which knows about it because it is referenced in SimulationOverview.fxml.

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        private void initialize()

      • setUp

        public void setUp(Capitalism capitalism)
        Called from capitalism as part of the startup process. Most early initialization is done here but note that everything in the .fxml files are set up by reflection in 'Initialize' after the fxml file is loaded. This method sets up the project tables and initializes the project cursor, sets up the timeStamp table and initializes the timeStamp cursor, and populates all the tables. Note that the Capitalism class initializes some variables after loading (and hence after calling initialize) but before calling this method, which gets the variables from Capitalism here.
        Parameters:
        capitalism - the main application that created this viewManager.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Complete re-initialisation of the whole database from user data. also reconstructs the main window and hence the entire display

      • addCustomControls

        private void addCustomControls()
        set up the globals grid to display Glabels that can be used display text, graphics and the relevant numeric value from the current Globals record set the values of the labels within which these numeric values will be displayed. See also (populateGlobalsGrid add the tabbedTableViewer and the displayControlsBar

      • populateGlobalsGrid

        private void populateGlobalsGrid()
        populate the number fields in the globals grid from the value of the Global persistent entity at the timeStamp given by the displayCurrsor

      • valueExpression

        public static double valueExpression(double intrinsicValueExpression,
                                     DisplayControls.DISPLAY_AS_EXPRESSION valuesExpressionDisplay)
        (for display purposes). Allows the user to view a value magnitude in either its intrinsic expression (time) or its extrinsic expression (money) depending on the setting of expressionDisplay
        Parameters:
        intrinsicValueExpression - the magnitude of value, expressed intrinsically (usually, time but developers may add other value categories with different dimensions)
        valuesExpressionDisplay - selects whether to display as an intrinsic or an extrinsic magnitude
        Returns:
        the requested expression of the value magnitude - unchanged if expressionDisplay is TIME but divided by MELT if expressionDisplay is MONEY

      • viewTimeStamp

        public void viewTimeStamp(TimeStamp selectedTimeStamp)
        reset the timeStampDisplayCursor after the user has made a selection
        Parameters:
        selectedTimeStamp - the timeStamp that the user selected

      • refreshDisplay

        public void refreshDisplay()
        Repopulate each ViewTable with its observable list. Called when either the underlying data changes because the sm has moved forward, or the user selects a new project or timeStamp for study..
